DOC.brief_summary: Data survival benefit adjuvant chemotherapy ( ACT ) concurrent chemoradiation ( CCRT ) locally advanced cervical cancer ( LACC ) still limited inconsistent . We investigate ACT survival benefit CCRT alone .
DOC.brief_title: Adjuvant Chemotherapy Locally Advanced Cervical Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: Concurrent chemoradiation ( CCRT ) standard treatment cervical cancer FIGO stage IIB-IVA call locally advanced cervical cancer ( LACC ) . However , failure rate treatment still high 30 % 40 % . This multi-center randomized control trial evaluate whether adjuvant chemotherapy ( ACT ) CCRT improve treatment outcome compare CCRT alone .
DOC.criteria: Age 1870 year Cervical cancer FIGO stage IIBIVA Histopathology squamous cell carcinoma , adenocarcinoma , adenosquamous cell carcinoma ECOG performance status 02 No history cancer except basal cell carcinoma Adequate bone marrow function ( WBC > = 3,000/mm3 , granulocyte > = 1,500/mm3 , platelet count > = 100,000/mm3 ) Bilirubin < 1.5 fold , SGOT/ SGPT < 1.5 fold normal limit , creatinine clearance > = 40 mg/dl Consent participate Paraaortic lymph node enlargement > 1 cm suspicious cancer metastasis CT MRI Adnexal mass physical examination image study Chronic illnesses e.g . renal failure/ impairment , peripheral central neuropathy , uncontrolled diabetes mellitus , HIV infection . Pregnancy lactation
